Class ReadX

java.lang.Object
model.ReadX
public class ReadX extends Object
This class is the controller of the program, the conexion between the view and the model.

  • Method Details

    • findUserById

      public User findUserById(String userId)
      This function searches for a user in a list of users by their ID and returns the user object if found, otherwise it returns null.
      Parameters:
      userId - The parameter "userId" is a String that represents the unique identifier of a user. The method "findUserById" searches for a user in a list of users by comparing their IDs with the given "userId" parameter. If a user with the matching ID is found, the method returns that user
      Returns:
      This method returns a User object with the specified userId if it exists in the users list, otherwise it returns null.

    • findProductById

      public BibliographicProduct findProductById(String productId)
      This function searches for a product by its ID in the list of books and magazines and returns the matching product.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of a product that needs to be found in a list of products.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a BibliographicProduct object, which is either a Book or a Magazine, depending on the ID provided as a parameter. If no product is found with the given ID, the method returns null.

    • findProductByName

      public BibliographicProduct findProductByName(String productName)
      This function searches for a product by name in the list of books and magazines and returns the matching product.
      Parameters:
      productName - a String representing the name of a product to search for in a list of BibliographicProduct objects.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a BibliographicProduct object, which represents a book or a magazine with the specified name. If no product with the specified name is found, the method returns null.

    • registerUser

      public String registerUser(String name, String id, double balance, int userType)
      The function registers a user with a given name, ID, balance, and user type, and returns a message indicating the success of the registration and the user's information.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user being registered.
      id - The ID of the user being registered.
      balance - The initial balance of the user's account.
      userType - an integer value representing the type of user being registered. A value of 1 represents a PremiumUser and a value of 2 represents a RegularUser.
      Returns:
      The method `registerUser` returns a `String` message indicating whether the user was registered successfully or not, along with the user information such as user type, name, id, registration date, and balance.

    • registerBook

      public String registerBook(String name, int pages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, double price, String review, int genre)
      The function registers a book with its information and genre in the list of products.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the book being registered.
      pages - The number of pages in the book.
      publicationDate - A Calendar object representing the date of publication of the book.
      url - The URL parameter is a String that represents the URL of the book's cover image.
      price - The price of the book being registered.
      review - The review parameter is a String that represents the review or critique of the book being registered.
      genre - The genre parameter is an integer that represents the genre of the book being registered. It can have a value of 1, 2, or any other integer. The value 1 represents the science fiction genre, the value 2 represents the fantasy genre, and any other value represents the historical novel
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that indicates whether the book was registered successfully or not, and includes the book information if it was registered successfully.

    • registerMagazine

      public String registerMagazine(String name, int pages, Calendar publicationDate, String url, double price, String preiodicity, int category)
      The function registers a new magazine with its information and category and adds it to the list of products.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the magazine being registered (String).
      pages - The number of pages in the magazine.
      publicationDate - A Calendar object representing the date of publication of the magazine.
      url - The URL parameter is a string that represents the URL of the magazine's cover image.
      price - The price of the magazine.
      preiodicity - The parameter "preiodicity" is likely a misspelling of "periodicity" and refers to how often the magazine is published (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly).
      category - an integer representing the category of the magazine. 1 represents "VARITIES", 2 represents "DESIGN", and any other integer represents "SCIENTIFIC".
      Returns:
      A message indicating that the magazine has been registered successfully, along with the information of the registered magazine.

    • initReadX

      public String initReadX()
      The function initializes and registers users, books, and magazines, and returns a message containing the registered items.
      Returns:
      The method `initReadX()` is returning a `String` message that contains information about registered users, books, and magazines.

    • modifyProduct

      public String modifyProduct(String productId, int dataToModify, String newStaus)
      This function modifies a bibliographic product based on the data to modify and the new status provided.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of the product to be modified.
      dataToModify - an integer representing which data field of the product to modify (1 for name, 2 for pages, 3 for publication date, 4 for URL, 5 for price, 6 for review/periodicity, 7 for genre/category)
      newStaus - The new value to be set for the specified dataToModify parameter.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the modification was successful or not.

    • deleteProduct

      public String deleteProduct(String productId)
      This function deletes a bibliographic product from the products list based on the ID provided.
      Parameters:
      productId - a String representing the ID of the product to be deleted.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message indicating whether the deletion was successful or not.

    • buyBook

      public String buyBook(String userId, String bookName)
      The function allows a user to purchase a book if they have enough funds and have not already purchased 5 books (unless they are a premium user), and returns a message indicating the success or failure of the purchase.
      Parameters:
      userId - A string representing the ID of the user who wants to buy the book.
      bookName - The name of the book that the user wants to buy.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a message (String) indicating the result of the book purchase operation.

    • subscribeToAMagazine

      public String subscribeToAMagazine(String userId, String magazineName)
      The function allows a user to subscribe to a magazine if they have enough funds and have not already subscribed to a 2 magazines (unless they are a premium user), and returns a message indicating the success or failure of the subcription.
      Parameters:
      userId - A string representing the ID of the user who wants to subscribe to a magazine.
      magazineName - The name of the magazine that the user wants to subscribe to.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that indicates whether the subscription was successful or not, and includes information such as the new balance of the user, the invoice, and any error messages.

    • displayAdvertising

      public String displayAdvertising(String userId, String productId, int currentPage)
      The function displays an advertisement based on the user's type, the product type, and the current page.
      Parameters:
      userId - A string representing the unique identifier of a user.
      productId - The ID of the product being displayed on the current page.
      currentPage - The current page number of the product being displayed.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String variable named "advertisement" which contains an advertisement message based on certain conditions.
